definition: to prepare to film/to plan a shoot
chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: It was more than one year ago when I heard about the preparation of this movie.
sentences.chinese: 记得刚听说片子筹拍的消息时，是一年多以前。

sentences.english: It is Billie Piper in 1984 China Central Television TV series.
sentences.chinese: 那是一九八四年中央电视台筹拍电视连续剧。

sentences.english: The sails have been stowed on the next "Pirates of the Caribbean" sequel.
sentences.chinese: 《加勒比海盗》下一部续集的筹拍计划已经提上日程。

sentences.english: In addition to that, the publicity of her to- be-pictured film Hua Hun.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，就是对筹拍《画魂》的宣传。

definition: to start shooting (a film)/to invest in (a movie)/to put (sth) up for auction
to begin shooting (a movie, a scene of a movie etc)/to start the bidding (auction)/to start a trading session (stock market)
cast and crew/performers and production team
to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
to take a screen test/to audition/screen test/audition/tryout
to act the leading role (in a movie or a play)/to star/lead actor
to put the last hand to (a book, a film etc)/to finalize/to kill-green (a step in the processing of tea leaves)
